post_text: Last Saturday, Ontario High School’s cross-country team swept the competition at the Bucyrus Elks Invitational! 🧹 Both the girls and boys teams made an amazing debut at the invitational. 🏃‍♀️🏃‍♂️ Congratulations, Warriors! 🥇 #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
🍎🧃 Ontario Local Schools offers meals to students enrolled in Ontario Elementary Virtual Program Grades K-5 and Ontario Online Academy Grades 6-12. Five breakfasts and five lunches will be prepared each week per student. Meals may be picked up at the main entrance of the school where each student attends on Mondays from 9:30 a.m. - 10:00 a.m.. If school is closed on a Monday for a holiday or a calamity day, meals may be picked up on the day immediately following the holiday or calamity day.

🥯 To receive weekly meals for your child(ren), visit https://www.ontarioschools.org/UpdatesPage.aspx and complete and submit an 𝘖𝘯𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘚𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘔𝘦𝘢𝘭 𝘍𝘰𝘳𝘮. It's that simple!

🥪 For questions regarding our meal program, please contact Eva Harmon, Food Service Manager at harmon.eva@olsohio.org or 419-529-3969 ext. 51413.

#TheWarriorWay #WarriorReady

post_text: ℹ️ Ontario High School will offer the PSAT on October 14. In addition to being a great primer for the SAT and even the ACT, the PSAT scores are used to determine eligibility and qualification for the National Merit Scholarship Program. 𝗕𝘆 𝗧𝘂𝗲𝘀𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗦𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿 𝟭𝟱, 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱 𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗴𝘂𝗶𝗱𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 $𝟭𝟳.𝟬𝟬 𝗲𝘅𝗮𝗺 𝗳𝗲𝗲. #TheWarriorWay #WarriorReady

post_text: The Ontario Middle School football team partnered with Hope for Every Heart Ministries, a nonprofit organization dedicated to giving hope to villages in Africa, to help a family in Uganda. The players earned money from doing chores and other activities to provide a donation of $1,000 to provide a widow and her children shelter and bedding. The family now has a home and the boys learned a valuable lesson in the importance of charity. Way to go, Warriors! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

post_text: Did you know? Sixth-grade students in Mr. Canfield’s social studies class have a chance to earn a STEM day, also known as FireFriday! If students turn in all their assignments and exhibit great citizenship according to #TheWarriorWay, they can earn two FireFridays a month. Last Friday, groups of students competed to build the tallest freestanding tower with only popsicle sticks and clothespins! Great job, Warriors! 👏 #WarriorReady

post_text: 📘 On the first day of school, Mrs. Jolin and her fifth-grade English language arts students read 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝘿𝙖𝙮 𝙔𝙤𝙪 𝘽𝙚𝙜𝙞𝙣 by Jacqueline Woodson. post_text: Ontario High School teacher, Mr. Nikiforow started the year off with a timely lab on face mask effectiveness in his biology and anatomy classes. 😷 Students completed trials at measured intervals to see if they could blow out a candle. Their results were impressive - most masks did not allow the candle to be blown out, even at 0 cm! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorReady

post_text:
Wyona Copeland, the wife of Roger Copeland, Ontario’s first and winningest football coach, archived every year of her husband’s football career at Ontario High School by collecting over 900 newspaper clippings and pasting them into three large scrapbooks. 🏈 Coach Copeland, now 92, donated her scrapbooks to the Ontario High School Athletic Department in a brief ceremony at Copeland Field on Tuesday, August 18. 🏟️ For more on this incredible story, visit https://tinyurl.com/y5d46c8x. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

𝘔𝘢𝘴𝘬𝘴 𝘸𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘳𝘦𝘮𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘱𝘪𝘤𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦.
text:
Wyona Copeland, the wife of Roger Copeland, Ontario’s first and winningest football coach, archived every year of her husband’s football career at Ontario High School by collecting over 900 newspaper clippings and pasting them into three large scrapbooks. 🏈 Coach Copeland, now 92, donated her scrapbooks to the Ontario High School Athletic Department in a brief ceremony at Copeland Field on Tuesday, August 18. 🏟️ For more on this incredible story, visit https://tinyurl.com/y5d46c8x. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

𝘔𝘢𝘴𝘬𝘴 𝘸𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘳𝘦𝘮𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘱𝘪𝘤𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦.

ℹ️ School supply drop off for 𝑺𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈𝒆𝒍 𝑬𝒍𝒆𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒓𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 is Monday, August 17 from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m..

🖍️ Label all supplies and place in a labeled bag.
🖍️ PTO will collect supplies from vehicles and deliver them to classrooms.
🖍️ Families unable to make this time can bring their supplies to school on the first day.
🖍️ Supplies ordered through the PTO for families choosing to do virtual learning can be picked up during this time.

We are very excited to welcome students back! #WarriorReady #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
Ohio Sales Tax Holiday is this weekend 𝗙𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟳 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝗦𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟵. During the holiday, the following items are exempt from tax:

👕 An item of clothing priced at $75 or less
✏️ An item of school supplies priced at $20 or less
📘 An item of school instructional material priced at $20 or less

This is a great time to get #WarriorReady! For more information, visit https://tinyurl.com/y6mgzgw2. #TheWarriorWay

𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 (OHS) school office will be 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 starting Monday, August 3 to support high school students and their families as they prepare for the new school year.

➡️ Parents intending to enroll their children at OHS should begin the registration process as soon as possible by completing Final Forms found on the district website (https://www.ontarioschools.org/).

➡️ Schedule changes can be made on Tuesday, August 4 and Wednesday, August 5. Call the guidance office at 419-529-7010 beginning Monday, August 3 for an appointment with your counselor.

➡️ Class schedules can be picked up from the school office beginning Tuesday, August 11 through Thursday, August 13 from 7:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. and 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m..

Due to COVID-19 guidelines, we will practice social distancing protocols and encourage all visitors to wear masks. #TheWarriorWay
text:
𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 (OHS) school office will be 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 starting Monday, August 3 to support high school students and their families as they prepare for the new school year.

➡️ Parents intending to enroll their children at OHS should begin the registration process as soon as possible by completing Final Forms found on the district website (https://www.ontarioschools.org/).

➡️ Schedule changes can be made on Tuesday, August 4 and Wednesday, August 5. Call the guidance office at 419-529-7010 beginning Monday, August 3 for an appointment with your counselor.

➡️ Class schedules can be picked up from the school office beginning Tuesday, August 11 through Thursday, August 13 from 7:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. and 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m..

Due to COVID-19 guidelines, we will practice social distancing protocols and encourage all visitors to wear masks. #TheWarriorWay

⭐ Reopening Plan ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/y8abrj23

If you have any questions regarding the upcoming school year, please contact Superintendent Lisa Carmichael at carmichael.lisa@olsohio.org or Director of Education Mike Ream at ream.mike@olsohio.org. #TheWarriorWay

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

post_text:
✍️ Mrs. Hynek’s third-grade students created stories with the theme 𝑴𝒂𝒈𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝑴𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒔 during their narrative writing unit. Final drafts were submitted to the MindSprouts Creative Writing program at Renaissance Theatre. ⭐

This year three finalists were selected from Mrs. Hynek’s class, including:
- Reese Miller for “The Spy Squad”
- Alex Simmering for “Lost in Space”, and
- Levi Walter for “The Missing Museum”

All finalists will have their pieces adapted to be presented in a virtual showcase this Saturday, June 20 at 7:00 p.m. on Renaissance Theatre and on their YouTube channel (https://tinyurl.com/yamw2amu ). Congratulations, writers! 👏 #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
⭐ Ontario Middle School sixth-grade students, 𝘼𝙢𝙗𝙚𝙧 𝙋𝙖𝙧𝙠𝙚𝙧 and 𝘼𝙞𝙡𝙚𝙚𝙣𝙖 𝙔𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙜, will be among those whose writing will be brought to life on stage, readers’ theatre style, during the ninth annual MindSprouts Creative Writing Showcase!

For this year’s theme, 𝑴𝒂𝒈𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝑴𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒔, Amber wrote a short story titled “The Magical Wand,” in which two middle school students find a magic wand in a tree and soon they are interacting with talking animals. Aileena composed a short story titled “Believe.” In it, a little girl named Marbella wants to know if the tooth fairy is real.

The showcase event will be held virtually this Saturday, June 20 at 7:00 p.m. on Renaissance Theatre and on YouTube at https://tinyurl.com/yamw2amu . Congratulations, Amber and Aileena! 👏 #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
𝙳𝚒𝚍 𝚢𝚘𝚞 𝚔𝚗𝚘𝚠? June is National Zoo and Aquarium Month! 🐘🦒🐠🦩 While zoos and aquariums are currently closed to visitors, many of them across the country are offering opportunities to check out some of your favorite zoo animals without leaving your house.

🦍 The Cincinnati Zoo offers a Home Safari Facebook Live event every Tuesday and Thursday at 3 p.m. through June 30. An animal is featured during each event and included is an activity you can do from home. Go to ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/y88mgjym for more information. 🐯

🐟 The Monterey Bay Aquarium offers opportunities to experience the wonder of the ocean no matter where you are. Go to ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/rwg2yvh to view any of the ten live cams. 🐡

🦥 The San Diego Zoo offers live cams of penguins 🐧, panda bears 🐼, hippopotamuses 🦛, and more. Go to ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/y2alsxaa to view your favorite animal!

Tell us - what is your favorite animal to see at the zoo? Comment below! #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
🎓 Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Alexa McCristall.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Basketball and track. I enjoy the outside and hanging out with friends and family. ❤️

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan to attend college where I will decide if I want to attend veterinary school to become a veterinarian, a zoologist, or a marine biologist. 🐬🐯

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Being with Mrs. Cain in her office having our daily chats! ❤️🥰

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: We are finally here! Not how we planned it, but we did it! Life is just so unexpected so live life to the fullest and take every opportunity that is thrown your way! 🌟

Alexa, we are so proud of you! We wish you and your classmates all the best in life! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

🎓 Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Alexa McCristall.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Basketball and track. I enjoy the outside and hanging out with friends and family. ❤️

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan to attend college where I will decide if I want to attend veterinary school to become a veterinarian, a zoologist, or a marine biologist. 🐬🐯

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Being with Mrs. Cain in her office having our daily chats! ❤️🥰

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: We are finally here! Not how we planned it, but we did it! Life is just so unexpected so live life to the fullest and take every opportunity that is thrown your way! 🌟

Alexa, we are so proud of you! We wish you and your classmates all the best in life! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
📣 Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Hailey Rose.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Drug Free Seniors, Buddy Mentoring Program, listening to records, going to youth group, and spending time with my friends and family. 🙂

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: Go to the Ohio State University at Mansfield to pursue my bachelor degree. Then transfer to the Ohio State University main campus for my Doctorate in Clinical Psychology. 📚

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Receiving a superior rating at district contest with the symphonic band two years in a row. 🎶

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: No matter what life throws your way, keep your head up and look for the positive outcomes in life! While these circumstances were definitely unforeseen, take a look at the bigger picture and see what you can do to help secure a good future for yourself and those around you. ❤️

Hailey, we are so proud of you! We know you and your classmates will do great things! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: 🏅 Ontario Middle School was represented exceptionally well in the virtual 𝙼𝚘𝚑𝚒𝚌𝚊𝚗 𝙳𝚒𝚜𝚝𝚛𝚒𝚌𝚝 𝚂𝚌𝚒𝚎𝚗𝚌𝚎 𝙳𝚊𝚢. 💻 𝑬𝒎𝒎𝒂 𝑯𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒓𝒔𝒐𝒏 earned a SUPERIOR rating with her project titled "𝘓𝘦𝘢𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘌𝘯𝘷𝘪𝘳𝘰𝘯𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵? 𝘛𝘩𝘢𝘵'𝘴 𝘏𝘦𝘢𝘷𝘺!". Emma also earned the Michael R. Hudson Young Scientist Award - awarded to two students who have the best projects. 𝑩𝒍𝒂𝒌𝒆 𝑫𝒆𝒘𝒆𝒆𝒔 and 𝑮𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒆 𝑻𝒉𝒆𝒎 also participated in the virtual science fair, both earning EXCELLENT ratings. ⭐ Great job, Warriors! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

⭐ Our Senior Spotlight shines on Sebastian Jones as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I played basketball 🏀, baseball ⚾, and football 🏈. I also showed hogs at the Richland County Fair through my 4-H club for almost six years. 🐖

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan on furthering my education at North Central State College for a year and then transferring to the University of Toledo or Western Governors University to obtain my degree in mechanical engineering. 📚

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memories from Ontario schools are the friendships I made. Although I came here in the 8th grade, everyone was still accepting and welcoming! …

post_text: ℹ️ There is potential for rain interfering with our Ontario High School graduation ceremony that is planned for this 𝗙𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟮𝟵 𝗮𝘁 𝟳:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺.. While we intend to have the ceremony, 𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲,if the weather is unsafe, we will move the ceremony to 𝗦𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟯𝟬 𝗮𝘁 𝟭𝟬:𝟬𝟬 𝗮.𝗺.. 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗯𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗙𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟮𝟴 𝗮𝘁 𝟮:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺.. If the ceremony is postponed, you will be notified by communication through our website (https://tinyurl.com/ybscl6uk), social media, and a phone message. #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
🎓 Our Senior Spotlight shines on Trevor Fox as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: My number one hobby is fishing. 🎣 I also like to hang out with my friends, hike, and listen to music! 🎶

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will be attending Ashland University to pursue a bachelor degree in nursing. 👨‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memories are of all the times I spent with my friends after football games going out to different restaurants and having a good time, as well as any class with Mr. Nikiforow. 📚

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: No matter what situation you find yourself in, you can get through it. There are always people around to help you if you are willing to give them a chance. You are never alone. You can do anything you want as long as you are willing to push yourself to succeed and not give up. ❤️

Trevor, we are so proud of you! We know you will succeed in pursuing your goals! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

🎶 𝘓𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘋𝘢𝘺 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦𝘴 𝘮𝘺 𝘧𝘦𝘦𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘭𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘸𝘦 𝘥𝘪𝘥𝘯’𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘶𝘳 “𝘭𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘥𝘢𝘺". - Lilly Casey, junior at Ontario High School.

In recognition of our focus on music today for 𝑽𝒊𝒓𝒕𝒖𝒂𝒍 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸, Lilly shared her original song 𝘓𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘋𝘢𝘺. Click on the image to listen to her beautiful song. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorWellness

🎶 𝘓𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘋𝘢𝘺 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦𝘴 𝘮𝘺 𝘧𝘦𝘦𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘭𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘸𝘦 𝘥𝘪𝘥𝘯’𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘶𝘳 “𝘭𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘥𝘢𝘺". - Lilly Casey, junior at Ontario High School.

In recognition of our focus on music today for 𝑽𝒊𝒓𝒕𝒖𝒂𝒍 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸, Lilly shared her original song 𝘓𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘋𝘢𝘺. Click on the image to listen to her beautiful song. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorWellness

YOUTUBE.COM
Last Day-Original Song by Lilly Casey

post_text:
🎓 Our Senior Spotlight shines on Riley Kinney as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: ⚽ I played soccer throughout my four years at Ontario High School and also played spring club ball. During my freshman year, I swam 🏊‍♀️ and ran track and field 🏃‍♀️.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: Attend Ohio State University Mansfield campus for one year and then transfer to main campus majoring in electrical engineering. 💡

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Although I have many memories I am fond of, I’d have to say the time the glow sticks were thrown during a pep rally during my freshman year. It was a huge wave and it was so surreal! Mr. Smith was NOT happy…

Today our 𝑽𝒊𝒓𝒕𝒖𝒂𝒍 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸 continues with a focus on movement. Some suggested activities include:
🔹 Pound Fitness class with Lisa McManes via Zoom. To attend a class, click on the link below today at 10:15 a.m., 10:45 a.m., 11:15 a.m., 11:45 a.m., or 12:15 p.m. Only 100 participants can attend at a time, so please only attend one session. Zoom link: https://tinyurl.com/ybuolt67 Password: OntarioGP

post_text: 🖊️ The regional Power of the Pen competition was scheduled to take place on March 14. The pandemic may have put a damper on many plans, but the Power of the Pen organization worked with Kent State University to allow district winners an opportunity to write for the regional competition. 💻 Our very own Trista Jewel, an eighth-grade student at Ontario Middle School, qualified and competed in the regional Power of the Pen competition from home on May 9. She wrote two stories during the allocated time period and is a winner to us! 🏆 Way to go, Trista! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

📘 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗠𝗶𝗱𝗱𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 yearbooks are ready for pick up next week! Yearbooks can be picked up at the school office from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. on the day students are scheduled to return school materials. If different arrangements need to be made, email Mr. Strickler at strickler.keith@olsohio.org. 💻

If you did not order a yearbook and have decided you want one, 20 extra copies were ordered and available for purchase while supplies last. Payment of $25 by cash or check made out to OMS will be accepted. The yearbook staff worked hard and learned a lot while creating this book and we know you will love the results! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

📣 Our Senior Spotlight shines on Grayson Jolley as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Music 🎶, swimming 🏊, and hanging out with friends. 🙂

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: Attend Kent State University majoring in computer science. 💻

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Learning French with Mrs. Riedel every morning. ☀️

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: Our class has made history. Anything else should be a piece of cake! 🍰

Grayson, we are so proud of you! We know you will make everlasting memories as you pursue
your goals! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Amelia Carmack. ⭐

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I participated in soccer, majorette, cheerleading and track and field. 🏃‍♀️

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will attend the College of Wooster on a pre-law track. 🎓

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Playing soccer and the bonds and memories created as a part of the team. ⚽

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: We have gone through so much loss as a class and have come out of it as stronger individuals. Be proud of what we have accomplished and continue to do great things. ❤️

Amelia, we are so proud of you! We know you and your classmates will continue to do great things! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

☀️ We are kicking off our 𝑽𝒊𝒓𝒕𝒖𝒂𝒍 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸 with Mindfulness Monday! Let’s start with a positive affirmation. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘨𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘢 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘥𝘢𝘺! Other suggested mindfulness activities include:
🔹 For our younger students, go to https://tinyurl.com/yakcjkye for an educational activity about worry.
🔹 Acknowledge and track emotions in a journal, such as the one available at https://tinyurl.com/yd6jwuh8.
🔹 Join a Yoga Live session with Aimee Monroe on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 1:00 p.m. - 2:00 p.m. 🧘 These sessions can be found on Ontario Youth Sports Facebook page.

📷 Snap a picture or video and share in a public post with #WarriorWellness to let us know how you are participating. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

🎓 Our Senior Spotlight shines on Carson Gear as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I am attending The Ohio State University to pursue a degree in architecture. 📐

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: Time in high school flies by and it's over before you know it. One day you'll be sitting in your first class of freshman year and then the next you'll be starting the last week of senior year. Cherish every moment of high school and make the most of your four years. ❤️

Carson, we are so proud of you! We celebrate you and your classmates as one chapter closes and another one opens! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will be attending Kent State University to major in nursing and minor in biology. ⚡️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memories from Ontario are going to watch all the sporting events against our rival school and being able to play the sport I love the most - volleyball. 🏐 I am honored to have played on that court and wear that jersey. I am so glad I got to play for amazing teammates and coaches and had a great support system from the community of Ontario. I will cherish the teachers, students, and coaches who have all made me who I am…

post_text:
📣 𝚂𝚝𝚒𝚗𝚐𝚎𝚕 𝙴𝚕𝚎𝚖𝚎𝚗𝚝𝚊𝚛𝚢 𝚏𝚊𝚖𝚒𝚕𝚒𝚎𝚜, let’s celebrate the end of the school year with a car parade! 🚗 You can decorate your cars or make signs to add to the fun! Teachers and staff will line the street in Marshall Park. Important details:
🎈Thursday, May 28 from 6:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m.
🎈Enter Marshall Park at 426 Shelby-Ontario Road, near Stingel Elementary
🎈Parents and students must stay in their cars
🎈No bikes, no walking, and no touching
🎈No gifts can be given
We are so excited to celebrate all your hard work! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
🎓 Our Senior Spotlight shines on Alexandra Reed as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: 🎶 Listening to music, drawing, ☀️ hiking, cooking, 📘 reading, and spending time with my family and friends.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will be attending Ashland University to pursue a degree in nursing. I hope to extend my nursing license to become a nurse practitioner specializing in psychiatric mental health. 👩‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memory from Ontario Schools would be the time Mr. Smith instructed everyone at an assembly to NOT throw their glow sticks and the second the lights went out EVERYONE threw their glow sticks. 😄

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: “In the book of life, the answers aren’t in the back” -Charlie Brown ❤️

Alexandra, we are so proud of you! We know you and your classmates will do amazing things! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: It’s Throwback Thursday! ⏰ We are going to wind the clock back to early March 2020 when Mrs. Carver’s second-grade class studied the force and motion science unit. post_text: 📣 THANK YOU to our seniors in the Drug Free Seniors program! This is a group of seniors who applied for and were selected to visit Stingel Elementary School to talk to younger students about making good choices and the importance of staying drug free. Drug Free Seniors has a huge impact in our school district and is the cornerstone of our substance abuse prevention program. 𝚃𝚑𝚊𝚗𝚔 𝚢𝚘𝚞, 𝚆𝚊𝚛𝚛𝚒𝚘𝚛𝚜, 𝚏𝚘𝚛 𝚢𝚘𝚞𝚛 𝚎𝚗𝚌𝚘𝚞𝚛𝚊𝚐𝚎𝚖𝚎𝚗𝚝 𝚊𝚗𝚍 𝚒𝚗𝚜𝚙𝚒𝚛𝚊𝚝𝚒𝚘𝚗! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

📣 Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Molly Mangan.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I played soccer ⚽, basketball 🏀, and ran track 🏃‍♀️. I love volunteering and spending time with friends and family.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will attend a regional branch of The Ohio State University for two years then transfer to main campus. As of now, my major is undecided. 🎓

post_text:
𝙆𝙣𝙤𝙬! 𝙔𝙤𝙪 𝘼𝙧𝙚 𝙉𝙤𝙩 𝘼𝙡𝙤𝙣𝙚. May is Mental Health Month and the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) is spreading the message: 𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘈𝘳𝘦 𝘕𝘰𝘵 𝘈𝘭𝘰𝘯𝘦. Now more than ever, people need to know they’re not alone. Go to https://tinyurl.com/yazsv234 to learn more and the opportunity to sign up for a newsletter from Prevention Action Alliance. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

Source: https://preventionactionalliance.org/

⭐ Our Senior Spotlight shines on Lauren Hartman as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I enjoy running, swimming, kayaking, hiking and hanging out with my friends. 🌞

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will attend Mount Vernon Nazarene University and major in social work. 🎓

Lauren, we are so proud of you! We know you and your classmates will do great things! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: 💻 Mrs. Theisen's AP students at Ontario High School (OHS) studied columnists and their rhetorical styles not only to prepare for an AP exam but to increase their own writing skills, critical thinking skills and analysis skills. The websites the students created are above and beyond Mrs. Theisen’s expectations. The articles were written by the columnists, but the analysis of the columnists and the website creation and designs were from our very own students at OHS! 👨‍💻👩‍💻 Well done Jason Lin, Gregory Tan, Vincent Chen, and Jaci Wentz! ⭐ #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: Continue to work part-time in the Army National Guard and go to college to get my bachelors degree in nursing. 👩‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memories at Ontario is cross country season. There was never a dull moment. 🙂

Jillian, we are so proud of you! We celebrate you and your classmates! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
📣 Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Faith Voelp.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: 🎶 Anything music related is my biggest hobby/inspiration, whether it be listening, playing, or recommending it! I also love to sew, draw, and skate.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will major in fashion design at the University of Cincinnati. 🧵

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My favorite memory has to be when my best pal, Syd, and I got to paint our parking spots. We were the first people there and the last ones to leave, which really shows that Monet was right when he (probably) said “art takes time.” 🧵

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: live, laugh, love! ❤️

Faith, we are so proud of you! We know you will leave a beautiful impact on the world! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

Following my first couple of years, I would like to continue to be traveling while I return back to school to get my license to become either a nurse practitioner or a nurse anesthetist. 👩‍⚕️

post_text: 👨‍🔬 Fourth-grade students in Mrs. Winningham’s class turned their kitchens into science labs to experiment with chemical changes. The students used ingredients, such as sugar, flour, and cinnamon to determine what easily dissolves in water. An added bonus - their math lesson on metric and standard measurements was applied. 👍 Great job, Warriors! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: 📣𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗧𝗿𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮 𝗝𝗲𝘄𝗲𝗹𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗿! Trista and Chase are Ontario Middle School’s recipients of the Archie Griffin award. The award is presented through the Ohio High School Athletic Association (OHSAA) and is awarded to one male and one female student athlete at each of Ohio’s middle schools and high schools who display exemplary sportsmanship. It is a great honor to receive the award. Great job, Trista and Chase! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay
text: 📣𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗧𝗿𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮 𝗝𝗲𝘄𝗲𝗹𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗿! Trista and Chase are Ontario Middle School’s recipients of the Archie Griffin award. The award is presented through the Ohio High School Athletic Association (OHSAA) and is awarded to one male and one female student athlete at each of Ohio’s middle schools and high schools who display exemplary sportsmanship. It is a great honor to receive the award. Great job, Trista and Chase! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Braeden Rachel. ⭐

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I love kayaking, hiking, singing, playing piano, and creating art! 🎨

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I am attending Miami University with plans to major in business and minor in interior design.

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: 🏟️ My fondest memories from high school are cheering under the Friday night lights and the annual bonfire event to kick off every football season. Another memory that I will cherish forever is each and every cabaret event that showcased the talent of Rhapsody In Blue. 🎶

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: My words of encouragement to my classmates is to live every day of high school as if it’s your last. COVID-19 has taught me many things and the most important thing is that you never know what life will throw at you so live with no regrets. ❤️

Braeden, we are so proud of you! We know you will live life to the fullest and do great things! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
📣 As we continue celebrating our Class of 2020 Warriors, our Senior Spotlight shines on Jordan Matthes.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: 🎶 I enjoy playing guitar, drums, video games on my hand-built computer, and rebuilding my 1945 Willys MB Jeep with my grandfather.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan on attending Mansfield branch of Ohio State University to acquire my general education credits. Then I will transfer to Ohio State University main campus to major in biology. I want to use the US Army’s Health Professions Scholarship Program to go to medical school. Afterwards I would like to go into general/thoracic surgery and probably open a missionary hospital in Tuvalu or Niue. 👨‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆…

post_text:
⭐ Today, our Senior Spotlight shines on Anya Doklovic. Join us as we celebrate Anya and our entire Class of 2020 Warriors!

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: playing tennis, listening to music and hanging out with friends! 🙂

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: In my junior year, I had a study hall with Mrs. Theisen. All year we tried to convince her to have a chair race down the hall. On the last day of school, she finally agreed. After we finished the race there was much debate over who won. To this day we still haven't decided. 🏆

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: Although this is not how we planned our senior year to go we should still remember all the memories OHS brought us. As we part ways and move on with our lives, one thing that you should always remember is Ontario - the place that made you who you are. ❤️

Anya, we are so proud of you! We are excited to see how you and your classmates change the world! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

I have done video chats through Google Meet where we discuss mindfulness. My students complete most of their work on Google Classroom through various docs, slides, and forms. I also use programs like FlipGrid and EdPuzzle to take their learning out of the same types of…

post_text:
📣 Join us as we continue celebrating our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Tytus Namenyi.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Basketball, football, fishing, lifting, and photography. 📷

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will enlist in the Air Force. 🇺🇸

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: Mrs. Wentz’s study hall. 📚

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: The good and the bad times will shape us to be the best person we can be. So never stop being true to who God made. Enjoy life with a big smile! 🙂

Tytus, we are so proud of you! We know you will continue to do great things in life - and or course, with a big smile! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

📘 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟰 - Students can pick up any personal items from the school and drop off library books. Students may come into the school from 𝟴:𝟬𝟬 𝗮.𝗺. 𝘁𝗼 𝟲:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺. to get any personal items from lockers and art projects. Please drop off ALL library books in the Commons if you come in that day.
📘 𝗙𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟮𝟮 - All assignments for fourth quarter are due by 𝟭𝟭:𝟱𝟵 𝗽.𝗺. 𝙎𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙤 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙥𝙡𝙚𝙩𝙚 𝙖𝙡𝙡 𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙞𝙜𝙣𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙩𝙝𝙚 4𝙩𝙝 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙚𝙧.
📘 𝗧𝘂𝗲𝘀𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟮𝟲 - Sixth-grade students return any school books or materials to the school from 𝟴:𝟬𝟬 𝗮.𝗺. 𝘁𝗼 𝟯:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺. Please drop off ALL… More

post_text:
📣 Join us as we continue celebrating our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Carolina Trumpower. ⭐

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Some of my hobbies include: running, reading, swimming, hiking, finding cool coffee shops with friends, and spending quality time with my family. 🌞

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan on going to the Mansfield branch of Ohio State University and pursue a degree in creative writing and human resources. I will also continue to run races wherever I can. 🏃‍♀️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My favorite memories during my short time at Ontario were definitely joking around with friends in the writing center. ❤️

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: I encourage future Ontario high school students to not procrastinate too much, branch outside their comfort zones, and make new friends.

Carolina, we are so proud of you! We think you have a bright future ahead of you as you chase your dreams! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
📣 Join us in celebrating our Class of 2020 Warriors! Our Senior Spotlight shines on Jaci Wentz.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: My favorite hobby is painting and drawing which was only made possible through the love and support of the Bukers. 🎨

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will pursue a degree in speech pathology.

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memories are those of laughter and fun with my classmates as we shared the experience unique to the Ontario School system. I will always remember the inside jokes and the good times we had on field trips like the cadaver lab and the Columbus Zoo. 🙂

Jaci, we are so proud of you! We celebrate you and your classmates! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
Mrs. Johnson, teachers, and staff have been working hard to prepare for parents to pick up their child's supplies on Monday. Thank you, Warriors, for continuing to be strong - even from a distance! 💛💙

ℹ️ 𝗦𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗹 𝗘𝗹𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀: student supplies and personal items can be picked up on 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟰 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝟴:𝟬𝟬 𝗮.𝗺. 𝘁𝗼 𝟲:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺. We’re asking that you stay in your cars and the items will be brought to you. 📚 The primary lot will be used for pick-up for students with last names beginning with A-K, and the intermediate lot will be used for pick-up for students with last names beginning with L-Z. #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: 🏊‍♂️ I enjoy lap swimming. It is great for exercise and to spend time with friends. I also enjoy spending time outdoors either detailing cars for my business, taking my boat out, or flying. ☀️ I also love going on long car rides with the windows down and listening to loud music!

post_text:
📣 Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Today, our Senior Spotlight shines on Joshua Carpenter.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I enjoy singing, acting, and tutoring. 🎶

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will be attending Northern Central State College and Ohio State University as an English major with a minor in theater. 🎭

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: Stay strong, stay determined and above all else be proud of what you've done in these times. These times are unprecedented but we will all be remembered as the class that was able to overcome any challenge that was laid in front of us and that is something to be extremely proud of. ❤️

Joshua, we are so proud of you! We think you will do amazing things with your talents in the next stage of your life! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

🍎 Our staff feature today is all about Shelby Wynn. Keep reading to learn how she is staying connected with her students. 💻

𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲: Fifth-grade science and social studies teacher at Stingel Elementary School 📘

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝘅𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝘀? Zoom has been wonderful in allowing me to connect face-to-face with my students which is something I really miss. It allows me to answer their questions and check in with how they are doing along with them being able to connect with each other. I have been making videos with instructions and have continued to use Google Classroom to share documents and grade assignments. 💻

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴…

post_text: 🌞 𝘐 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘺 𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴. 𝘐 𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘥𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘰𝘧𝘵𝘦𝘯. 𝘛𝘩𝘢𝘯𝘬 𝘺𝘰𝘶. Mrs. Jolin’s outside writing activity was just what her fifth-grade Language Arts students needed. The students spent five minutes outside with their eyes closed then wrote about what they heard and felt. It was an opportunity to slow down and notice the ordinary daily things outside. 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

📘 𝕀𝕥'𝕤 𝕒𝕝𝕨𝕒𝕪𝕤 𝕒 𝕘𝕠𝕠𝕕 𝕥𝕚𝕞𝕖 𝕥𝕠 𝕣𝕖𝕒𝕕. Lysandra, a senior at Ontario High School, is using this time during the stay-at-home order to re-read books from sophomore English class. Her favorites include: 𝘓𝘰𝘳𝘥 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘍𝘭𝘪𝘦𝘴 by William Golding and 𝘏𝘪𝘮 by Pierre A. Jeanly. 📚 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

"𝘙𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘶𝘴 𝘴𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘰 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘸𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘸𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦." - Mason Cooley

post_text:
Our staff feature continues today with Kellie Ritchey. Keep reading to learn about Kellie and how she is supporting her students and their families during these unprecedented times. 💻

𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲: Seventh-grade language arts teacher at Ontario Middle School 📘

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝘅𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝘀? We are using Google Classroom to connect. I don't want our families to stress so we are sticking with the basics to keep our skills sharp: writing, vocabulary, and grammar. ✏️

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲? I have learned that I never want to teach online again! I miss my students' smiling faces.

𝗜 𝗹𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 … Ontario has the best students and families. ❤️

Kellie, we agree - Ontario has the best students and families! We also have the best teachers! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
👩‍🔬👨‍🔬 “I think my favorite part as a teacher was watching the students react to their experiments’ reaction!” - Mrs. Benny. 🙂 Mrs. Benny’s fourth-grade students experimented with changes in matter for science class. The experiments ranged from elephant toothpaste, see-through eggs, slime, and many others. The students had to:
🧪 explain the form of matter that took place before, during, and after,
🧪 identify if a chemical or physical change took place,
🧪 and have fun!
Great job, scientists! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! Today, our Senior Spotlight shines on Ashten Vavra. ⭐

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I enjoy reading 📚, writing, exploring, playing basketball 🏀, and spending time with my friends. I like to engage in activities that challenge my mind and also encourage imagination.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will be attending a 4-year University to pursue a degree in both psychology and early childhood education with the hopes of one day being able to serve in the Peace Corps. 🕊️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: My fondest memory from Ontario Schools would be all of the field days that we had throughout elementary school. I also enjoyed…

post_text:
Today, we turn our focus to Kyle Ward. Keep reading to learn how he supports his students during virtual learning. 💻

𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲: Fourth-grade Intervention Specialist at Stingel Elementary 🍎

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝘅𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝘀? Every week, I check in with all of my students and their families through email and phone calls to see how things are going and determine how I can support them better. I hold open help sessions through Zoom three times a week where students on my caseload can come to ask questions, work through an assignment together, or just come to talk to me. Additionally, I am providing instruction in specific goal areas in… More

post_text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. #TheWarriorWay #InThisTogetherOhio
text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. #TheWarriorWay #InThisTogetherOhio

📣 ℕ𝕒𝕥𝕚𝕠𝕟𝕒𝕝 𝕃𝕚𝕓𝕣𝕒𝕣𝕪 𝕎𝕖𝕖𝕜 is here! 📚 During these unprecedented times, our library buildings are closed but they continue to serve our community through digital access and programs. Some reminders:
📚𝐅𝐨𝐫 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐠 𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬: Mansfield Richland County Public Library children department is showing an abbreviated story time on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 10:30 a.m. Visit https://tinyurl.com/wqr5pml to view story time. In addition, the library has uploaded videos to their Facebook page of local authors reading their stories.
📚𝐅𝐨𝐫 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬: The Ontario High School Library website (http://ontariohighschoollibrary.weebly.com/) has updated resources to help with assignments. You can also visit the website to view reading recommendations under 𝙗𝙤𝙤𝙠 𝙛𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚𝙨.

#TheWarriorWay #NationalLibraryWeek

post_text:
Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! ⭐ Our Senior Spotlight shines on 𝙈𝙮𝙡𝙖 𝘾𝙧𝙚𝙚𝙙.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I enjoy doing yoga, hiking, drinking lots of iced coffee, and watching 𝙁𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙨 with my sister.

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan on studying nursing at Ashland University. 👩‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: 🏊‍♀️ Getting to compete in swimming at the State level with the friends I grew up with and becoming an All-Ohioan my senior year.

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: The future is never promised so enjoy the little things in life and never take anything for granted.

We are so proud of you, Myla! Your accomplishments in high school are just the beginning of your bright future! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I plan on studying nursing at Ashland University. 👩‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: 🏊‍♀️ Getting to compete in swimming at the State level with the friends I grew up with and becoming an All-Ohioan my senior year.

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: The future is never promised so enjoy the little things in life and never take anything for granted.

We are so proud of you, Myla! Your accomplishments in high school are just the beginning of your bright future! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: ❤️ “𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰𝘯’𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘩𝘰𝘸 𝘮𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘴𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘦𝘢𝘯𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘶𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘭 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰𝘯’𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘪𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘺𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦.” - a sweet sentiment shared by one of Mrs. Winningham’s fourth-grade students. While the class hasn’t seen each other in a while, those smiling faces sure show how happy they are to see their friends! 🙂 The experience provided a wonderful way for everyone to share what they have been doing such as: learning Spanish, helping parents clean, and even learning to make balloon animals! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn
text: ❤️ “𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰𝘯’𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘩𝘰𝘸 𝘮𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘴𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘦𝘢𝘯𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘶𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘭 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰𝘯’𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘪𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘺𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦.” - a sweet sentiment shared by one of Mrs. Winningham’s fourth-grade students. post_text:
📣 As we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors, our Senior Spotlight shines on 𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙤𝙧 𝙈𝙘𝘾𝙖𝙪𝙡𝙚𝙮.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: I enjoy playing soccer, running, and creating art. 🎨

𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹: I will be attending the University of Mount Union to pursue a nursing degree. 👨‍⚕️

𝗙𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀: One of my fondest memories includes racing down the hallways on rollie chairs. It was the last day of school and I was hounding Mrs. Theisen to let us do it until she finally conceived. Olivia Todd ended up falling out of her chair and I won the race. 😂

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: We have been through thick and thin together. All the challenges we have faced as a class have made us more than acquaintances. We are a community and a family. Once again, we are faced with another challenge, but I am confident that we will get through this and come out stronger together. 💛💙

We are so proud of you, Connor! You are correct - we WILL get through this strong together! Cheers to you and your classmates! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: 🎶 I spend most of my free time listening to and playing music. I love to play classical piano, especially pieces written by Chopin and Brahms. Students in Math 8 have been completing review assignments over content previously covered via Edulastic and referencing their online textbook and notes. These students have also been completing skills work on Moby Max each week to work on mathematical skills at their level and to improve new skills. post_text:
📚 Today’s staff feature is someone you will most likely see with a book in hand - Jodi Wentz! Keep reading to learn about the many roles Jodi hasand how she is staying connected with her students.

𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲: Ontario High School librarian and teacher of novels, public speaking, and yearbook 📘

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝘅𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝘀? I use Google Classroom and email. 💻

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲? I find purpose and energy from the students, and I miss them dearly.

𝗜 𝗹𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 … Our school is more than a building. We are a strong community that helps one another. ❤️

Jodi, thank you for sharing your love of books and our community! We couldn’t help but share a picture from her previous home, where she and her husband designed and painted a beautiful staircase dedicated to books. 📚 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
Join us as we continue to celebrate our Class of 2020 Warriors! 📣 This Senior Spotlight shines on 𝙇𝙞𝙯𝙯𝙞𝙚 𝘽𝙪𝙧𝙨𝙤𝙣.

𝗔𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗼𝗯𝗯𝗶𝗲𝘀: Reading, playing guitar, kayaking, and hiking ☀️

𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬: As a class, I have watched us go through so much in the last 5 years, starting in 8th grade and continuing into an unpredicted time in our senior year. That has built a bond between us that no other class has had. It has made us realize how precious life is and how quickly everything can be taken from us. So, my hope for all of us is that we go out into the world realizing the fragility of life and may it shine through our actions and words with everyone we encounter. ❤️

We are so proud of you, Lizzie! We appreciate your outlook on life and can’t wait to see you go out into the world and let your light shine! 💛💙 #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
⭐ Our staff feature for today is Brenda Andress. Keep reading to learn how she is navigating through this pandemic and why she loves Ontario Local Schools.

𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲: Intervention Specialist at Ontario High School

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝘅𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝘀? I’m using email, Google Classroom, phone calls and Zoom in the near future. 💻

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲? How to enjoy peace and solitude that social distancing affords in spite of missing important people in my life including the students at Ontario.

𝗜 𝗹𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗢𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗼 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 … we approach adversity with unity, strength, and perseverance that is unstoppable. ❤️

Brenda, we appreciate how you leverage multiple technology tools to remain engaged with your students! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: The American Red Cross 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 local volunteers during the COVID-19 pandemic. They are looking for volunteers willing to help at blood drives, support disaster service, and work-from-home volunteers. All required training and resources will be provided. Interested? 🙋 Please send an email to volunteerohio@redcross.org or visit www.redcross.org/volunteer. Blood donors are also needed. Visit www.redcrossblood.org to find the closest donation site to schedule an appointment! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

📚 🅁🄴🄼🄴🄼🄱🄴🅁 🅃🄾 🅁🄴🄰🄳 📚 Libraries may be physically closed, but there are several valuable online resources available through our libraries for all ages!

📚𝐅𝐨𝐫 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐠 𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬: The Mansfield-Richland County Public Library children's department is showing an abbreviated story time on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 10:30 a.m. Visit https://tinyurl.com/wqr5pml to view story time. In addition, the library has uploaded videos to their Facebook page of local authors reading their stories.
📚𝐅𝐨𝐫 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬: The Ontario High School Library website (http://ontariohighschoollibrary.weebly.com/) has updated resources to help with assignments. You can also visit the website to view reading recommendations under 𝙗𝙤𝙤𝙠 𝙛𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚𝙨.

Happy reading! 📕🐛#TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
The #OMSWeeklyChallenge is back! The second weekly activity challenge for Ontario Middle School students is to create a Harptoon. If you are not familiar with Harptoons, you can go to their website (https://www.harptoons.com/what-is-harptoons.html) and see that they are cartoon drawings created by Steve Harpster (a fellow Buckeye)! The Harptoon video section (https://www.harptoons.com/drawing-videos.html) on the website has instructions on how to create your own version of a Harptoon! Have FUN and see what you can doodle. 🖍️

When you’ve finished a drawing(s), send a photo of yourself and your drawing to Mrs. Johnson (johnson.m@olsohio.org). If you also share your doodle on your personal social media page, tag #OMSWeeklyChallenge. If the post is public, we can see and share your amazing drawings! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text:
***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We want to take this opportunity to thank our entire staff for their hard work, and all of our families for their ongoing support. We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

post_text: Earlier this week, our friend in the second-grade created a board game as part of a STEM project! While this wasn’t created specifically for the board game #StingelChallenge yesterday, we were so excited to share his version of Monopoly. post_text:
As we all know, the past several weeks have been full of emotions, questions and uncertainty as we navigate through uncharted territory in both our families and schools. Children may be asking more questions like “what’s going to happen?” and as a parent/caregiver, you may be wondering how you can better support your children and focus on the positive.

As a resource, we’re providing this diagram which shows what you control, what you don’t, and how to respond accordingly. As always, our school counselors/social workers are always available for questions or guidance during this time. We’re all in this together and are here to support you!

Amy Nagel (Ontario Local Schools) ➡️ nagel.amy@olsohio.org
Tod Petit (Stingel Elementary) ➡️ petit.tod@olsohio.org
John Boyd (Ontario Middle School) ➡️ boyd.john@olsohio.org
Veronica Cain (Ontario High School) ➡️cain.veronica@olsohio.org
Sharon McCormick (Ontario High School) ➡️ mccormick.sharon@olsohio.org

#TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

𝐂𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐎𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐨 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 (𝐎𝐌𝐒) 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬! We have a challenge starting tomorrow, through next Saturday, March 28 - complete a jigsaw puzzle! That's right, a multi-piece jigsaw puzzle. When a puzzle has been completed, send an email to Mrs. Johnson at johnson.m@olsohio.org by Saturday, March 28, including:

🧩your name and grade
🧩a photo
🧩the number of puzzle pieces

If you/your student also want to post a picture on social media, tag #OMSWeeklyChallenge. If the social media account is public, we can also see and share the photos on Ontario’s social media pages. Have fun - we can’t wait to see what puzzles you complete! #TheWarriorWay

post_text: Our staff has not stopped working and supporting our students, and this is proof! Our related service personnel, namely occupational therapy, physical therapy, and speech-language pathologists are preparing packets to send home to our students who receive therapy services. These packets contain tips for parents/guardians to continue working with their child(ren) on fine motor skills, gross motor skills, and communication skills. Remember … we’re all in this together! #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
𝐔𝐏𝐃𝐀𝐓𝐄𝐃 𝐈𝐍𝐅𝐎𝐑𝐌𝐀𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍 𝐚𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡 𝟏𝟑 𝐚𝐭 𝟏𝟏:𝟏𝟒 𝐚.𝐦..

Following Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement earlier today, Ontario Local Schools will be closed effective 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡 𝟏𝟔, 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐥 𝟏𝟎, 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎 due to COVID-19. All information and updates associated with this situation will be posted as they are made available at http://www.ontarioschools.org/UpdatesPage.aspx. We invite you to bookmark this page and check back frequently. Thank you for your patience during this unpredictable time. #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
Second-grade students in Mrs. Horning’s class had a BALL while learning and building teamwork skills with peers! Student activities included:

🍝using dry spaghetti noodles to participate in a STEM activity
➡️determining if the amount of force affects the distance a cotton ball travels
📏determining the height a ball bounces based on how high it’s dropped

After all class data was collected, students came up with the median. What a great way to work together, get up and move around the classroom and learn! #TheWarriorWay

➡️determining if the amount of force affects the distance a cotton ball travels
📏determining the height a ball bounces based on how high it’s dropped

After all class data was collected, students came up with the median. What a great way to work together, get up and move around the classroom and learn! #TheWarriorWay

She will move around the building after she is officially trained, but right now she has lots of visitors! 🐶#TheWarriorWay

Did you know? This month is Music in our Schools Month - and after this past weekend, we have one more reason to be proud of our music programs at Ontario!

🎼CONGRATULATIONS to our Symphonic Band on a SUPERIOR performance at the OMEA district 10 band contest. The band earned high marks across the board for their performance (including the highest in sight-reading) and has now qualified for the STATE contest for the fourth consecutive year! THANK YOU to everyone who supports our amazing students - this is truly music to our ears! #TheWarriorWay

post_text: Arguing isn’t something that should happen in a classroom, unless you’re an 8th grade Language Arts student! Recently these students have been working on an argumentative project and it kicked off with each student choosing a different topic to take a position on. Next, students had to research and find two sources to support their claim and one source to support a counterclaim. After writing an argumentative essay, they created a Google Slideshow to present to the class. Many students chose to survey their classmates to collect real world data to include in their presentations. Included in this project, students also created an advertisement trying to persuade their audience to come to their side. They all did an outstanding job arguing their positions! 🗣️#TheWarriorWay

post_text: Can you be easily convinced? Students in Mrs. Benny’s, Mrs. Alt’s, and Mr. Ward's 4th grade class found out which one of their peers can be! They had to create their own cereal, and write a persuasive essay to convince others to buy it. 🥣Students had a blast coming up with slogans, gimmicks, and catchy jingles to promote their brand - we hope they were kid tested and mother approved. Here are a few of the cereals they created ... and they’re g-r-r-reat! #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
KINDNESS has been spread through hallways, conversations, hearts and books this month at Stingel Elementary as students celebrated Kindness Month. ❤️

Students in Mrs. Leach’s, Mrs. Thomas’, and Mrs. Calhoun’s 1st and 2nd grade classes read and learned a lesson from the book 𝑬𝒂𝒄𝒉 𝑲𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒏𝒆𝒔𝒔. The lesson started by dropping different sized rocks into a tub of water to show the ripple effect. Over the course of two days they read the book and discussed what the ripple effect was in the book. Next, students were each given a small ❤️to hold as quotes from the book were shared. Teachers then asked students to share how they thought the characters felt in those moments. They concluded by having a discussion on how sometimes we miss out on opportunities to show kindness and how we need to wake up intentionally each day and show kindness to others in simple, ordinary ways. Wow, what an important lesson these teachers shared with their students! #TheWarriorWay

It’s FRIDAY, and we’re ending your week with an Ontario’s Own spotlight featuring Danielle Basham!

𝐑𝐨𝐥𝐞: 7th grade math teacher at Ontario Middle School

𝐓𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐎𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐨 𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐥 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥𝐬: In the 4th year

𝐇𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐨𝐰𝐧: Mansfield

𝐅𝐮𝐧/𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐞𝐥𝐟: My little piece of heaven on earth is Siesta Key, Florida. I have also been to Disney World 35 times. ☀️

𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐝𝐨𝐞𝐬 𝐢𝐭 𝐦𝐞𝐚𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐥𝐢𝐯𝐞 #𝐓𝐡𝐞𝐖𝐚𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐨𝐫𝐖𝐚𝐲? For me, I try to do my best to live my life with integrity, show compassion, and be respectful to my fellow Warriors.

𝐇𝐨𝐛𝐛𝐢𝐞𝐬: I love to spend time playing games with my family. 🎲👨‍👩‍👧‍👦

𝐈 𝐥𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐎𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐨 𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐥 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥𝐬 𝐛𝐞𝐜𝐚𝐮𝐬𝐞… my students and colleagues make me feel at home.

Danielle, we’re glad you are part of our Ontario community and appreciate your dedication to your students!

#TheWarriorWay #OntariosOwn #FeatureFriday

post_text:
Ontario's own, Caitlin Fanllo, won the Mansfield Noon Optimist Club essay contest on the prompt: 𝑰𝒔 𝒐𝒑𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒊𝒔𝒎 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒌𝒆𝒚 𝒕𝒐 𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒊𝒆𝒗𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒅𝒓𝒆𝒂𝒎𝒔 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒊𝒎𝒂𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒆?. She will now compete at the district level for a scholarship of $3,500 - the international scholarship is worth $22,500!

CONGRATULATIONS, Caitlin and good luck in the next stage of competition! 🏅#TheWarriorWay

post_text: Yesterday, Mrs. Nugent's class at Stingel Elementary participated in the school wide " ❤️attack" kindness initiative to spread kind words and cheer to teachers and staff members around the school. Students worked in partners to make a list of people to give hearts to, then made a large chart and assigned partners to create hearts. Finally, students put on their sneaky sneakers and crept around the school to place hearts on doors for teachers to find. It was a fun project with a lot of laughs! #TheWarriorWay

post_text: For two weeks in February, each grade level at Stingel Elementary had a love bug! ❤️ 🐜 Each classroom kept the love bug for one day, added something clever to it, and then passed it on to a different classroom in their grade level. When the bug was passed, students could also send a small act of kindness for the next class. After a whole lot of KINDNESS, all love bugs were turned in for voting! We’re happy to say CONGRATULATIONS to the 4th grade team - you are the WINNER of the love bug decoration contest! ❤️ 🐜 #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
🎉🎉Let’s hear it for our Lady Warriors who competed in the State Meet last week! As a team, the girls ended up in 10th place overall in Division 2; our HIGHEST finish in school history! Here are a few more accomplishments to celebrate:

🏊‍♀️200 Free Relay team of: Brie Trumpower, Tiffany Whittaker, Ava Ruhe, and Amy Evans finished in 5th place - State Finalist Podium
🏊‍♀️100 Free: Brie Trumpower finished in 8th place overall - State Finalist Podium
🏊‍♀️400 Free Relay Team: Brie Trumpower, Natalie Link, Ava Ruhe, and Amy Evans finished in 12th place.
🏊‍♀️200 Medley Relay Team: Jennifer Crum, Myla Creed, Amy Evans, and Ava Ruhe finished in 14th place.
🏊‍♀️200 Free: Freshman Brie Trumpower finished in 15th place.

We are proud of each and every one of you and how you represented our district! #TheWarriorWay

post_text: Yesterday, 6th grade students from Ontario Middle School enjoyed an enLIGHTening energy conservation presentation sponsored by First Energy.💡A theater group performed a variety of skits as they discussed energy in their lives and in particular, conservation. Each student received an energy conservation kit which included: energy-saving bulbs, power strips, LED's, and night lights. The assembly allowed students to follow along easily based on what has recently been taught in their science class - what a great way to connect the dots! #TheWarriorWay

“Don’t let someone dim your light simply because it's shining in their eyes.” -Unknown

Every Friday, students in Mrs. Jolin’s 5th grade English Language Arts class start by writing a positive message on a sticky note to a classmate. What a great way to spread kindness and bring a smile to a peer’s face! Some students even tape the note in their agenda as a constant reminder! #TheWarriorWay #MotivationalMonday

post_text:
Now, this is flipping exciting! Two Ontario High School student-athletes competed in the OHSAA District Gymnastics Meet yesterday at BGSU!
🤸🏻Sophomore Chasity Meis (📷3rd from the L) had a big day and is State Bound - finishing in 3rd place in both the vault and floor exercises. Her 9th place overall score advanced her to the State Finals next week! 🏅
🤸🏻Sophomore McKenna Gorbett also participated; landing All-District honors with a 7th place finish in the uneven bars. 🏅

Congratulations Lady Warriors - we are proud of you! #TheWarriorWay

post_text: Pennies, nickels and dimes, oh my! Ontario Middle School students and staff donated their change toward “Stall Your Teacher Day” and raised a grand total of 💲𝟭𝟭𝟭𝟬.𝟴𝟭 for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society! This annual event includes students “stalling” the start of the period by having teachers count the change … the more there is, the longer it takes for class to begin! This is just one more example of how Ontario Schools has great FUNdraising opportunities! 💵#TheWarriorWay

We are so pleased to share that Ontario Schools, through their incredible generosity, collectively raised $9,147 for the 2019 United Way Campaign! This was the most that our schools have EVER raised for United Way! We know how much this money will do for our community, in the form of health, family, emergency services, and youth development. 𝐓𝐇𝐀𝐍𝐊 𝐘𝐎𝐔 to all who participated through employee pledges from our Board Office, Stingel Elementary, OMS and OHS, student fundraisers, and a multitude of fundraising initiatives!

Last night, the Board of Education (aka 𝘍𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘍𝘭𝘶𝘳𝘳𝘪𝘰𝘶𝘴) and the Administrative Team put the FUN in fundraising! They participated in the United Way 𝘊𝘩𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘺 𝘖𝘱𝘦𝘯 at Snow…

During the course, they learned about kitchen safety, sanitation, and measuring and made: a drink, dip, pepperoni roll, and cookie recipe. 🥤🍪 What a tasty class with real-life applications! #TheWarriorWay

post_text: In January, Mrs. Secrist’s 3rd grade class learned about soil layers, the water cycle, and plant life cycles through their science standards. 🌱Students learned about the importance of recycling and reusing. To apply what they learned, they reused pop bottles to create terrariums! After 4 weeks, the students are excited to see some serious growth even in these cold, winter months. 🌿#TheWarriorWay
text: In January, Mrs. Secrist’s 3rd grade class learned about soil layers, the water cycle, and plant life cycles through their science standards. 🌱Students learned about the importance of recycling and reusing. To apply what they learned, they reused pop bottles to create terrariums! After 4 weeks, the students are excited to see some serious growth even in these cold, winter months. 🌿#TheWarriorWay

post_text: Members of the Ontario High School Student Leadership Committee and FCCLA sold Valentine Candy Grams last week and raised $87! 🍬Collectively, they voted to donate their profits to the National Alliance on Mental Illness NAMI - Richland County. post_text:
As a reminder, preschool registration for 2020 - 2021 is OPEN! You can begin the process and review FAQ’s by going to ➡️ http://www.ontarioschools.org/PreSchool.aspx. Teacher requests are not taken; however, AM or PM preference can be given during developmental screenings. Reservations will be accepted for the following programs:

🖍️Monday - Thursday
8:40 a.m. - 11:40 a.m. - morning class

🖍️Monday - Thursday
12:40 p.m. - 3:40 p.m. - afternoon class

If you are accepted into the program, you will be notified in late-May. #TheWarriorWay

ⒸⓄⓃⒼⓇⒶⓉⓊⓁⒶⓉⒾⓄⓃⓈ to our Ontario High School (OHS) Warrior Swim Team members that qualified at the BGSU Districts for the State Meet on Thursday, February 20, and Friday, February 21 at Canton McKinley High School! Myla Creed, Jenny Crum, Amy Evans, Ava Ruhe, Natalie Link, Tiffany Whittaker, and Brienne Trumpower will all represent OHS - Go, Warriors! 🏊‍♀️🎉 We can’t forget to mention our (200 Free Relay) team of Evans, Ruhe, Link, and Trumpower who swam away as DISTRICT CHAMPIONS! An exit "Clap Out" will take place on Wednesday, February 19, at 2:45 p.m. at OHSl! Friends and family are encouraged to come out and help us cheer on our Lady Warrior Swimmers! 👏🏻#TheWarriorWay
